ClassDesc: Controller for DetailsSupportFragment parallax background and embedded video play. The parallax background drawable is made of two parts: cover drawable (by default @B_android#support#v17#leanback#graphics#FitWidthBitmapDrawable_E@) above the details overview row and bottom drawable (by default https:##developer#android#com@B_android#graphics#drawable#ColorDrawable_E@) below the details overview row. While vertically scrolling rows, the size of cover drawable and bottom drawable will be updated and the cover drawable will by default perform a parallax shift using @B_android#support#v17#leanback#graphics#FitWidthBitmapDrawable#PROPERTY_VERTICAL_OFFSET_E@. @B_android#support#v17#leanback#app#DetailsSupportFragmentBackgroundController#enableParallax_E@ and/or @B_android#support#v17#leanback#app#DetailsSupportFragmentBackgroundController#setupVideoPlayback_E@ explicitly. The PlaybackGlue is automatically @B_android#support#v17#leanback#media#PlaybackGlue#play_E@ when fragment starts and @B_android#support#v17#leanback#media#PlaybackGlue#pause_E@ when fragment stops. When video is ready to play, cover drawable will be faded out. Example: To customize cover drawable and/or bottom drawable, app should call @B_android#support#v17#leanback#app#DetailsSupportFragmentBackgroundController#enableParallax_E@. If app supplies a custom cover Drawable, it should not call @B_android#support#v17#leanback#app#DetailsSupportFragmentBackgroundController#setCoverBitmap_E@. If app supplies a custom bottom Drawable, it should not call @B_android#support#v17#leanback#app#DetailsSupportFragmentBackgroundController#setSolidColor_E@. To customize playback fragment, app should override @B_android#support#v17#leanback#app#DetailsSupportFragmentBackgroundController#onCreateVideoSupportFragment_E@ and @B_android#support#v17#leanback#app#DetailsSupportFragmentBackgroundController#onCreateGlueHost_E@.
